alert.note: Alert for Orange (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 5:44PM EDT until September 01 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Orange. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Ocoee, Winter Garden, Winter Park, Windermere, Pine Hills, Oak Ridge, Oakland, Orlovista, Bay Hill, Universal Studios, Doctor Phillips, Fairview Shores, Eatonville, Gotha, Lake Butler, Tildenville, Paradise Heights and Killarney. - The heaviest rain has fallen along Colonial Drive near Pine Hills, Orlovista, and Ocoee, west of downtown Orlando. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
